poem:
**Breathless New Dawn**

Inhale the sweet promise
of an uncharted morning,
only to find your breath stolen,
your lungs a pair of weary travelers
still catching up.

Vapor or smoke, no matter—
young bodies, once boundless,
now struggle
in the simple air,
wheezing through futures
they had yet to imagine.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Vaping damages young people’s lungs as much as smoking, study suggests Vaping damages young people’s lungs as much as smoking, according to research that has prompted fresh debate over the health risks of e-cigarettes. The study compared vapers and smokers in a strenuous exercise test and found both groups emerged as being less fit and much more out of breath than people who have neither habit. Dr Azmy Faisal and colleagues at Manchester Metropolitan University". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
